events.originalText: Forty-three students of the Ayotzinapa Rural Teachers' College in Iguala, Mexico, were kidnapped and probably later killed.
events.subtitle: Ayotzinapa Rural Normal School
events.headline: 43 Students Kidnapped from Ayotzinapa Rural Teachers' College in Iguala, Mexico

events.originalText: Scottish aid worker Linda Norgrove and three Afghan colleagues were kidnapped by members of the Taliban in Kunar Province, Afghanistan.
events.subtitle: Death of Linda Norgrove
events.headline: Scottish Aid Worker Linda Norgrove Kidnapped by Taliban in Kunar Province, Afghanistan

events.originalText: Swiss pilot and inventor Yves Rossy flew a wingpack powered by jet engines across the English Channel.
events.subtitle: Yves Rossy
events.headline: Swiss Pilot Yves Rossy Flies Wingpack Across English Channel

events.originalText: The racing yacht Australia II, captained by John Bertrand, won the America's Cup and ended the New York Yacht Club's 132-year defence of the trophy.
events.subtitle: Yacht racing
events.headline: Australia II Wins America's Cup, Ending New York Yacht Club's 132-Year Defense

events.originalText: Cold War: Soviet lieutenant colonel Stanislav Petrov averted a potential nuclear war by identifying as a false alarm signals that appeared to indicate an impending U.S. missile attack.
events.subtitle: Cold War
events.headline: Soviet Lieutenant Colonel Stanislav Petrov Averts Nuclear War

events.originalText: The Beatles completed the recording of John Lennon's song "Happiness Is a Warm Gun", regarded by all the band members as their favourite on the album The Beatles.
events.subtitle: The Beatles
events.headline: The Beatles Complete Recording of 'Happiness Is a Warm Gun'

events.originalText: The Cambodian–Vietnamese War formally ended with the withdrawal of Vietnamese forces from the People's Republic of Kampuchea, a client state it had implemented to overthrow Democratic Kampuchea and the Khmer Rouge.
events.subtitle: Cambodian–Vietnamese War
events.headline: Cambodian–Vietnamese War Ends with Vietnamese Forces Withdrawal

events.originalText: Japan was struck by Typhoon Vera, the strongest and deadliest typhoon on record to make landfall on the country, causing damage in excess of US$261 million and more than 5,000 deaths.
events.subtitle: Typhoon Vera
events.headline: Typhoon Vera Strikes Japan, Causing Over 5,000 Deaths

events.originalText: World War II: The Soviet Army completed the Tallinn Offensive, driving German forces out of Estonia.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Soviet Army Completes Tallinn Offensive, Driving German Forces from Estonia

events.originalText: As gangster Machine Gun Kelly surrendered to the FBI, he supposedly shouted "Don't shoot, G-Men!", which became a nickname for FBI agents.
events.subtitle: Machine Gun Kelly
events.headline: Machine Gun Kelly Surrenders to FBI, Shouts 'Don't Shoot, G-Men!'

events.originalText: The Republic of China adopted Gwoyeu Romatzyh (designer pictured) as the official system for romanization of Mandarin Chinese.
events.subtitle: Nationalist government
events.headline: Republic of China Adopts Gwoyeu Romatzyh for Romanization of Mandarin Chinese

events.originalText: The Nationalist government of China adopted Gwoyeu Romatzyh as the official system for the romanization of Mandarin Chinese.
events.subtitle: Nationalist government
events.headline: Battle of Polygon Wood Begins Near Ypres, Belgium

events.originalText: World War I: The Battle of Polygon Wood, part of the Battle of Passchendaele, began near Ypres, Belgium.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: New Zealand Officially Becomes Dominion

events.originalText: The British Colony of New Zealand officially became a dominion to reflect its political independence since the 1850s.
events.subtitle: Colony of New Zealand
events.headline: Francis Drake's Golden Hind Completes Circumnavigation of the Globe

events.originalText: English explorer Francis Drake's galleon the Golden Hind (replica pictured) sailed into Plymouth, completing his circumnavigation of the globe.
events.subtitle: Francis Drake
events.headline: Pope Alexander VI Issues Papal Bull Marking Spanish Colonization of Americas

events.originalText: Pope Alexander VI issued the papal bull Dudum siquidem, one of the Bulls of Donation, marking the beginning of the Spanish colonization of the Americas.
events.subtitle: Pope Alexander VI
events.headline: William II Crowned King of England

events.originalText: William II, son of William the Conqueror, was crowned king of England.
events.subtitle: William II of England
events.headline: Julius Caesar Dedicates Temple of Venus Genetrix in Rome

events.originalText: Julius Caesar dedicated the Temple of Venus Genetrix in Rome to Venus, the mythical ancestor of his family.
events.subtitle: Julius Caesar
